</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Math - Geometry </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Cosine of a number, argument in degrees. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''cos''' x </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  x: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[cos]] 60;//returns 0.5</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[acos]], [[sin]], [[asin]], [[tan]], [[atan]], [[atan2]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 8, 2006 - 23:54
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]<dd class="note">Be aware that there might be rounding errors in the results of this command.

 cos 90

for example doesn't return the expected '0', but '-4.37114e-008'. So, if you want to compare results of Cosinus, don't use the compare operator

 (cos 90)<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>==</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext>0

but rather use less than.

 (cos 90) < 0.00001


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
